data.title: Horrible service
data.text: I sat at the bar while waiting for the person joining me for dinner, it took almost 15 minutes to get a drink with 3 servers and a bartender when there was only a few tables and no other bar guests. At 9pm I go to the hostess stand to be seated and stood there waiting for at least 5 minutes while the hostess was practically sitting on top of a guy in the waiting area, while watching me stand there. She finally got up to do her job when a server looked lost trying to figure where to seat me. They dumped the iced tea right before I tried to order one. I order the first round of food then they tell me the kitchen is closing at 9:20. So instead of ordering food and pissing off the kitchen, getting poor quality food, we left and still had to pay. They had already locked the doors, turned off the lights and broken down the sushi bar. The time I dined here before this, I sat at a table for 10 minutes until someone finally came up to greet me and my hibachi food was never delivered to the table. Never coming back!!!

data.title: You had to eat all the food or they charged you extra!!!!!!!
data.text: My son and daughter-in-law had been here before and decided to take the "Cali" grandkids. Nice looking place. We got seated fast but then it was after lunch crush. Sat down and looked at the menu. We decided on the buffet - all you can eat BUT.. they charge you for any food left on your plate! Say what? When I tried to get the waitress to be more specific as to how much can be left with out getting charged - she could not answer. 5 grains of rice, 10? No answer. Everything seems to be as they see it. Due to dietary restrictions there are certain foods I can only eat a small amount of and they bring it out in standard size portions. She said she could not bring just a sampling. I was so angry, I got up and left the table to sit in the lobby and wait for the rest of the family to finish. I had asked for the manager and when she finally presented herself I was really ready to leave. She even had a male server stand with her as she spoke with me. Yeah like this old lady was gonna pop her. Now that is just insulting. I ended up eating two very tiny spring rolls and drinking water just to keep my family happy.  I have NEVER been to an all you can eat buffet that charges you for what is left on your plate or only serves you their size portions and I will never return to this place again. If you go be prepared to lick your plate or you may get charged. By the way the kids said the food was good. It was just too stressful to me to see an already high buffet price and know that they would add to to it.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: This restaurant does 'all you eat' a little differently.  You order what you want off the menu and they deliver it.  If you want more, they will make it fresh and bring it and so on till you are full.  I like that actually.  It's all you can eat, sushi is good and fresh, and they offer lots of different dishes for non-sushi lovers.

data.title: AYCE Sushi Good deal on Groupon
data.text:
I've been here twice. Both times we used a Groupon. The food is good, but the service is average. 
We arrived at 5:05 and were told the restaurant was'nt open yet. NOTE:Park in the Bank St building behind the restaurant, it's free. McArthur Center parking lot cost $1 but it's a longer walk.
Once we were seated, our waitress, A.J.(?) was very attentive. She served our drinks quickly and put in our 1st order and child's order quickly. We received it quickly. They do have an appetizer bar that comes with the meal and is very good.
As the restaurant becomes busier, the service and your orders are slower.
My advice: Have a good idea what you want and order everything on the 1st order. Keep in mind, they charge you for leftover food.
Another downside, our son had to go to the restroom and discovered the bridge over the water. Of course he could'nt stay away from it. I think he was annoying some of the patrons and the manager.
With that said, the restaurant is not kid friendly (ages 3 to 12).
We spent $35. Included BOGO adult, child's chicken nugget meal and 2 sweet teas + $10 tip. (I tip on original price and tax)
1 block from the Norva.
We would go back.

data.title: Good
data.text: This place is great.. i really like it... the only thing i would recommend the owner is that they keep the property running like new. Dont let it fall into a black hole... first thing when u walk in they have a cardboard box with liquid stacked behind the hostess stand... the thing has been there for at least 4 months... move it or find someplace behind the bar so your entrance looks clean..

data.title: Double Charging People - Possible Fraud
data.text: I went to Sushi King in Norfolk, VA twice on 15 May 2016.  Once with a friend during lunch, and once with my husband for dinner.  Both times, food and wait staff were good.  Upon checking my credit statement though, Sushi King had charged me 3 times; twice were my totals including the tip, and then once for the total without a tip.  I gave the transaction a few days to see if it fell off my account as an accidental charge, but once it posted, I went back to Sushi King to resolve the issue.  The manager took my credit information from me to compare to her records, then came back without my information.  She continued to try and talk in circles, without giving me my information back and tried to act like the fact that she was trying to keep it wasn't concerning.  She was extremely rude, and I had to yell at her before she would finally give me back my credit information.  She refused to reimburse me for the extra charge.  In the midst of all of this, she also said that this had happened to other people that week, and she would not refund them their money as well.  I'm providing this review, because I am concerned that they are committing fraud.

data.title: Discriminate customers
data.text: They cancelled our reservation and made us wait. The family was seated on three different tables. Was given a plastic forks to eat while other customers using metal forks.They made me feel like we are contagious. The waitress said they don't have metal. Wont come back to this restaurant never again.

data.title: Great all you can eat.
data.text: Took two grown kids and the wife for a pretty good deal.  Doesn't happen often, but those two went away pretty darn happy. Great options, including vegetarian. Great atmosphere as well.

data.title: Glad I had a groupon
data.text: Not sure what I expected for an all you can eat, but the food was average at best. You could only get sashimi for an extra $0.50 per piece, the rolls were huge - mainly because of so much rice! Where's the fish? You are warned not to leave food on your plate or you might receive a surcharge.

data.title: All you can eat for only $19!!!
data.text: My boyfriend and I go all the time because it's a perfect date spot. They also have free parking if you get a voucher from them. It's in a great location; parallel to MacArthur Center and up the road from the Norva. I love the decorations and the "starlit night". Service has been choppy though; sometimes we'll go and it'll be 5 star service and other times it will be more like 2 1/2.

data.title: Excellant Sushi
data.text: All you can eat Sushi, everything is fresh, and dozens of different rolls to pick from.  Service outstanding.  We have visited two of their places, both places food was very good.

data.title: AYCE!
data.text: All you can eat sushi, hot foods, salad, dessert, and soups for $13 for lunch- $19 for dinner and you pay for your own drinks.  Make sure you finish what you order or they will charge for uneaten food. Food is quick, cheap, fresh and tasty. The staff is very nice. Dinner has more varieties of sushi and salads. The only thing they can do to make this better is by adding crab legs and raw bar and raise the price by a tad bit. Will definitely be back again shortly!!

data.title: Chain sushi with amazing food/decor
data.text: This is one of the best sushi places I've ever been to. The dinning room area is almost magical. The food/service took a dip recently but hopefully it's just a phase. I've been coming here for a while and I'm always happy when I leave.

data.title: All-you-can-eat meets fine dining
data.text:
I have been to dinner and again for lunch at this location.  I'm not well-versed in sushi.  That said, I had no idea what to expect.  Each time we were seated and handed a menu to keep throughout the dining experience.  You order, food is promptly delivered, you order more.  The decor is amazing - modern and oozes upscale - check out the chandelier in the bar area.  The center of the dining area is where the pros prepare the sushi.  You receive an entire roll each time. Everything is delicious and fresh.  I typically order crab rangoons more than once because they are small, bite size pillows of goodness - and served 4 at a time.

Dinner was $19 and lunch was $12 - worth it.  There are currently Groupons.

LOVE this place and learning about sushi - servers are very helpful and will gladly bring over additional sauces to dip in or try - eel sauce - who knew is was yummy?
